Class SparseFactorTableBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.analog.lyric.dimple.factorfunctions.core.FactorTableBase
      • com.analog.lyric.dimple.factorfunctions.core.SparseFactorTableBase

extends FactorTableBase

      • hasSparseEnergies

        public final boolean hasSparseEnergies()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        True if underlying representation of table values includes an array of energies indexed by a sparse index and a second array that maps sparse indices to joint indices.

        This is the optimal representation for methods that get/set energy by sparse index.

        Specified by:
        hasSparseEnergies in interface IFactorTableBase
        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.hasSparseWeights(), IFactorTableBase.hasDenseEnergies()

        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable

        Specified by:
        hasSparseIndices in interface IFactorTable

      • hasSparseWeights

        public final boolean hasSparseWeights()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        True if underlying representation of table values includes an array of weights indexed by a sparse index and a second array that maps sparse indices to joint indices.

        This is the optimal representation for methods that get/set weight by sparse index.

        Specified by:
        hasSparseWeights in interface IFactorTableBase
        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.hasSparseEnergies(), IFactorTableBase.hasDenseWeights()

        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase

        See Also:

      • setDirected

        public final void setDirected(@Nullable
               java.util.BitSet outputSet)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Designates directionality of factor table by specifying which of its domains are outputs.

        Note that this may change the indexing of the table's values in both sparse and dense formats. You can only rely on the indexing not to change if all output domains are at the front of the domain list (i.e. JointDomainIndexer.hasCanonicalDomainOrder()).

        Specified by:
        setDirected in interface IFactorTable
        Parameters:
        outputSet - if null, makes the table undirected otherwise this should turn on bits corresponding to the domains that are to be designated as outputs. The highest bit must be less than the number of domains (IFactorTableBase.getDimensions()).

      • getEnergySlice

        public final double[] getEnergySlice(int sliceDimension,
                      int... indices)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Returns an array of energies for the sliceDimension of the factor table with all other dimensions fixed to provided values.

        Same as IFactorTable.getEnergySlice(double[], int, int[]) but always allocates a new array.

        Specified by:
        getEnergySlice in interface IFactorTable
        See Also:
        IFactorTable.getWeightSlice(int, int[])

      • getEnergySlice

                      Value... values)
        Specified by:
        getEnergySlice in interface IFactorTable

      • getRepresentation

        public final FactorTableRepresentation getRepresentation()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Returns an enum indicating the underlying representation of the factor table.

        The representation may be changed via IFactorTable.setRepresentation(FactorTableRepresentation) but can also be changed implicitly as a side effect of certain other methods:

        • IFactorTable.getEnergiesSparseUnsafe()
        • IFactorTableBase.getEnergyForSparseIndex(int)
        • IFactorTable.getIndicesSparseUnsafe()
        • IFactorTable.getWeightForSparseIndex(int)
        • IFactorTable.getWeightsSparseUnsafe()
        • IFactorTable.setEnergyForJointIndex(double, int)
        • IFactorTable.setEnergyForSparseIndex(double, int)
        • IFactorTable.setWeightForJointIndex(double, int)
        • IFactorTable.setWeightForSparseIndex(double, int)
        • IFactorTableBase.sparseIndexFromJointIndex(int)
        • IFactorTableBase.sparseIndexToJointIndex(int)
        Specified by:
        getRepresentation in interface IFactorTable

      • getWeightSlice

        public final double[] getWeightSlice(int sliceDimension,
                      int... indices)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Returns an array of weights for the sliceDimension of the factor table with all other dimensions fixed to provided values.

        Same as IFactorTable.getWeightSlice(double[], int, int[]) but always allocates a new array.

        Specified by:
        getWeightSlice in interface IFactorTable
        See Also:
        IFactorTable.getEnergySlice(int, int[])

      • replaceEnergiesSparse

        public final void replaceEnergiesSparse(double[] energies)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Replace the energies/weights of the table from the given array of energies in order of sparse index. This does not alter the sparse to joint index mapping.

        Specified by:
        replaceEnergiesSparse in interface IFactorTable
        See Also:
        IFactorTable.replaceWeightsSparse(double[])

      • replaceWeightsSparse

        public final void replaceWeightsSparse(double[] weights)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Replace the energies/weights of the table from the given array of weights in order of sparse index. This does not alter the sparse to joint index mapping.

        Specified by:
        replaceWeightsSparse in interface IFactorTable
        See Also:
        IFactorTable.replaceEnergiesSparse(double[])

      • setConditional

        public final void setConditional(java.util.BitSet outputSet)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Makes table directed and verifies that its weights are normalized correctly.

        Similar to IFactorTable.setDirected(BitSet) but does not allow a null argument and will throw an exception if not IFactorTableBase.isConditional().

        Specified by:
        setConditional in interface IFactorTable

      • setEnergiesSparse

        public final void setEnergiesSparse(int[][] indices,
                     double[] energies)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Sets representation to FactorTableRepresentation.SPARSE_ENERGY with provided weights for each set of indices.

        Specified by:
        setEnergiesSparse in interface IFactorTable
        Parameters:
        indices - are the combined element indices of the entries to put in the table.
        energies - specifies the energies of the table in the same order as indices.
        See Also:
        IFactorTable.setEnergiesSparse(int[], double[]), IFactorTable.setWeightsSparse(int[][], double[])

      • setWeightsSparse

                    double[] weights)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Sets representation to FactorTableRepresentation.SPARSE_WEIGHT with provided weights for each set of indices.

        Specified by:
        setWeightsSparse in interface IFactorTable
        Parameters:
        indices - are the combined element indices of the entries to put in the table.
        weights - specifies the weights of the table in the same order as indices.
        See Also:
        IFactorTable.setWeightsSparse(int[], double[]), IFactorTable.setEnergiesSparse(int[][], double[])

      • makeConditional

        public final void makeConditional(java.util.BitSet outputSet)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Makes table directed and normalizes its weights to conditional form if necessary.

        Equivalent to calling IFactorTable.setDirected(BitSet) followed by IFactorTableBase.normalizeConditional() but requires that outputSet is non-null.

        Specified by:
        makeConditional in interface IFactorTable
